Package com.github.grhscompsci2.java2DGame

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.github.grhscompsci2.java2DGame.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class Board
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class controls the JPanel where the game logic and rendering happen. You will need to edit the attributes to add your enemies and player classes so they can draw and act here.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • initBoard

        private void initBoard()
        This method will initialize the key listener, load the background image, set the window size to the size of the image, and initialize an actor. When you are modifying this for your game, you should initialize all of your actors that need to be used in the game.

      • getPreferredSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
        Returns the preferred size of the background. Used to set the starting size of the JPanel window.
        Overrides:
        getPreferredSize in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • loadBackground

        private void loadBackground()
        This method will assign the BACKGROUND_FILE_NAME as the background of the JPanel. The background.png file will determine the resolution of your screen. All of your other sprites should match the resolution of the background.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method will draw everything in JPanel. It will update the scale so when the JFrame is resized, the image will resize to maintain the aspect ratio.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()

      • updateGame

        private void updateGame​(double deltaTime)
        This method is called once per frame. This will allow us to advance the game logic every frame so the actors move and react to input.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - the time elapsed since last tick

      • drawGame

        private void drawGame()

      • checkCollisions

        public void checkCollisions()
        This method will check each actor to see if the bounding box overlaps the bounding box of any other actor. Not the most efficient, but will work for small games.
